sanger.math.set
Class AbstractSet

java.lang.Object
  sanger.math.set.AbstractSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
NaturalDomain, NaturalSet
public abstract class AbstractSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Abstract implementation of a finite, set of natural numbers.

The set can be stored internally in either the bounds or the binary mode. The bounds mode is specified by the min and max values, which is memory efficient but only supports continuous intervals. The binary mode stores an OpenBitSet, consuming more memory for large sets, but capable of encoding non continuous intervals. When continuous, the set will automatically collapse to the bounds mode. AbstractSet.SetTopology.EMPTY sets are defined as a special case of the bounds mode where both min and max are set to Integer.MIN_VALUE.

Author:
Lior Galanti

Method Detail

topology

public AbstractSet.SetTopology topology()
Evaluates the AbstractSet.SetTopology of the set. The value indicates that the following conditions hold:
  • AbstractSet.SetTopology.EMPTY: min == Integer.MIN_VALUE && max == Integer.MIN_VALUE && map == null
  • AbstractSet.SetTopology.CLOSED: min > Integer.MIN_VALUE && max > Integer.MIN_VALUE && min >= max && map == null
  • AbstractSet.SetTopology.FRAGMENTS: min == Integer.MIN_VALUE && max == Integer.MIN_VALUE && map != null

Returns:
The current topology

clear

protected void clear()
Resets the set to a valid AbstractSet.SetTopology.EMPTY state, regardless of its initial state.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Convenience function for testing if the set is empty.

Returns:
True if the set is AbstractSet.SetTopology.EMPTY.

isContinuous

public boolean isContinuous()
Convenience function for testing if the set is continuous. A set is continuous if it is either AbstractSet.SetTopology.CLOSED or AbstractSet.SetTopology.EMPTY.

Returns:
returns True if the set is continuous.

Make this set contain the same elements as the other set.

Parameters:
other - The set to copy from.

closureCardinality

public int closureCardinality()
Compute the cardinality of the set's closure. The closure is the smallest continuous set that contains the set.

Returns:
Cardinality of the set's closure.
